The file common-extended.css will include any CSS added via the extension points described below.

section.title: Extension points
section.p: CSS rules are always position dependent - the rule defined last in a file will supercede previous definitions. This plug-in is offers three extension points where CSS can be appended to a file so that CSS rules can be added in order.

ul.li: extend.css.process.pre - Runs an additional ANT target before the extended css processing stage.
extend.css.process - Runs an additional ANT target as part of the extended css processing stage.
extend.css.process.post - Runs an additional ANT target after the extended css processing.
